content.question: In his atomic theory, Dalton proposed that all atoms of a given element are identical. Which of the following observations provides the best evidence that the proposal is incorrect?

choices.label: The mass spectrum of <math alttext="C u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>u</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a peak at <math alttext="63 a m u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>63</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>u</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and another peak at <math alttext="65 a m u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>65</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>u</mtext></math>.

The ionic radius of <math alttext="C l with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> is <math alttext="0.181 nanometer" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.181</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>n</mtext><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the atomic radius of <math alttext="C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></math> is <math alttext="0.079 nanometer" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.079</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>n</mtext><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The dipole moment of <math alttext="O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> is <math alttext="0.53 debye" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.53</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>d</mtext><mtext>e</mtext><mtext>b</mtext><mtext>y</mtext><mtext>e</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the dipole moment of <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="0.00 debye" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>d</mtext><mtext>e</mtext><mtext>b</mtext><mtext>y</mtext><mtext>e</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Elemental <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> can exist in both white and red forms.

content.answer: The mass spectrum of <math alttext="C u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>u</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a peak at <math alttext="63 a m u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>63</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>u</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and another peak at <math alttext="65 a m u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>65</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>u</mtext></math>.

skill.text: 4.B: Explain whether a model is consistent with chemical theories.
